channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says he may want to give you a tariff rebate check: ‘A little rebate for people of a certain income level might be very nice’
item.description: Trump has been busy in July, with a deal to bring real sugar back to (some) Coke recipes, visits to the Federal Reserve, and demands about sports team...

item.title: From ‘diversity of viewpoints’ to ‘cowardly capitulation,’ the Paramount/Skydance merger clears in a storm of controversy
item.description: “Americans no longer trust the legacy national news media to report fully, accurately, and fairly. It is time for a change," FCC Commissioner Brendan ...

item.title: America is starting to eat Trump’s tariffs TACO salad, UBS says
item.description: "It's quiet ... a little too quiet," writes Mark Haefele, chief invesmtent officer of UBS Global Wealth Management.

item.title: Controversial Interior Department Aide From DOGE to Leave Agency
item.description: Tyler Hassen, a former oil executive who had spent time on Elon Musk’s cost-cutting team, faced criticism because he had been given broad authority to...

item.title: Behind Trump’s War With Powell: A Battering Ram With 3 Million Followers
item.description: The director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency has made the removal of the Fed chair his personal mission.

item.title: Intel plans to slash 25,000 jobs in 2025 as new CEO warns ‘there are no more blank checks’
item.description: CEO Lip-Bu Tan sent a memo informing employees of significant ongoing layoffs and cost-cutting.

item.title: Israel to Allow Aid Airdrops Over Gaza During Starvation Crisis
item.description: Jordan and the United Arab Emirates were expected to begin airdrops in the coming days, but experts warned that the bulk of necessary aid could come o...

item.title: The World Must See Gaza’s Starvation
item.description: Today, many children in Gaza are so hungry they may never recover, and our supplies are critically low.

item.title: Trump defeats Australia’s mad cow disease restrictions in deal to ship American beef overseas
item.description: The Trump's administration claimed it as a major victory over “non-scientific trade barriers.”

item.title: How Will David Ellison Tackle the Big Problems at Paramount?
item.description: The cable business has cratered. The news division is in turmoil. A.I. is coming for movies. And those are just the obvious challenges.

item.title: Thailand Warns of War With Cambodia as Deadly Clashes Enter 2nd Day
item.description: More than 100,000 people have been displaced in the deadliest conflict between the two nations in 14 years.

item.title: Spat Between Thai and Cambodian Leaders Fuels Deadly Border War
item.description: A personal feud between two of Southeast Asia’s political titans is inflaming the worst violence on the border in more than a decade.

item.title: Patrick Ryan, ‘Terror Priest’ Who Aided the I.R.A., Is Dead at 94
item.description: He funneled cash and weapons to the Irish Republican Army from Libya, and was involved in bombings that targeted Margaret Thatcher and others, killing...

item.title: Trump Flies to Scotland, Leaving Chaos Swirling in Washington
item.description: The five-day visit will be a mix of personal business and golf, with some diplomacy thrown in.
